revised_title: Richard Waller, S.R.S.: A Life Dedicated to the Pursuit of Nature
tldr: The article delves into the life and contributions of Richard Waller, a member of the Royal Society and its Secretary from 1687-1709, 1710-1714. Waller was a multi-talented individual, involved in translation, illustration, and editing, as well as administration for the Royal Society. His life offers insights into the circulation of scientific ideas among provinces, London, and abroad, and showcases how an artistically inclined amateur could devote his talents to experimental science. Waller's relationships with prominent figures like Robert Hooke, Edmond Halley, and Sir Hans Sloane are also explored.
